id: # id is a string to identify the project
# enable_setting is a | separated list of settings that must be true for this project to be enabled.
# project_type is the type of the project. Currently supported ones are 'terraforming'
# tooltip is how this project is displayed on the buttons on the UI. Sorry it's a terrible name
# intel_complete_message is what's shown when the project completes. If it's empty
# requirements is a JSON array of objects. Each object requires a 'requirement_id' field that is the requirement ID as specified in 'terraforming_requirements.csv'. These are checked in an AND manner
enable_settings: ie all of the requirements have to be true for this check to return true. Each object may have an optional 'and_then' field that is a requirement list. The requirements in the 'and_then' field are only checked if the initial requirement is satisfied.

id: # requirements_hidden is the same as requirements
enable_settings: but they must be met for the project to be visible. Both this and requirements must be met for the project to be started

id: # base_project_duration is the base number of days the project takes to complete
# dynamic_project_duration_modifiers is a JSON array of objects. Each object requires a 'modifier_id' field that is the modifier ID as specified in 'duration_modifiers.csv'.

enable_settings: reset} is the same as 'requirements'. If any of the requirements is satisfied

id: # project_complete_effects is a JSON array of objects. Each object requires an 'effect_id' field that is the effect ID as specified in 'project_complete_effects.csv' that happens when the project is completed.

project_type: disrupted} is a list of requirement IDs same as requirements. They're for determining whether the project is incomplete
intel_complete_message: as well as the tooltip to show for each requirement

incomplete_message: Approximately $percentComplete% of the decivilized subpopulation on $marketName has been eradicated.
An investigation into the whereabouts of the rogue AI core on $marketName is approximately $percentComplete% complete.

tooltip: Construct an astropolis station in orbit around a planet or moon.
Construct a mining station in an asteroid belt or asteroid field.
Construct a siphon station in low orbit around a gas giant.
Use a planet-killer device to destroy a colony. This will severely damage relations with most major factions in the Sector.
